initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories: The International Poetry Slam is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Paris, France. You can find out all about the event right here. The US's entry for 2024 is Maya Angelou's words, which will be performed by a talented spoken word artist. But how's she feeling ahead of the big night, where she'll perform in front of a packed audience of poetry enthusiasts! De-Graft sat down with her to find out all about her preparation for the competition. The International Poetry Slam will be streamed live on YouTube and Facebook on Saturday 18 May.

The whispers of the wind are gathering in Tokyo, Japan, as the World Music Festival approaches. This year, the city's neon-lit streets will reverberate with the rhythms of a thousand cultures. You can tune in to the global broadcast to experience the fusion of sounds from around the world. Japan's entry for 2024 is the haunting melodies of a traditional shamisen, performed by a virtuoso musician. But what's behind the inspiration for her unique composition, which will transport the audience to a world of ancient traditions and modern innovation? De-Niro sat down with her to uncover the secrets of her creative process. The World Music Festival will be broadcast live on YouTube and Spotify on Sunday 21 July.

The scent of jasmine is wafting through the alleys of Marrakech, Morocco, as the annual Sufi Music Festival draws near. This year, the city's vibrant souks will resound with the devotional chants of mystical orders from across the Middle East. You can join the global gathering to experience the symphony of voices and instruments, a testament to the power of spirituality and community. But what lies behind the inspiration for his hypnotic rhythms, which will transport the audience to a realm of ancient wisdom and modern expression? Aisha sat down with him to unravel the mysteries of his creative journey. The Sufi Music Festival will be broadcast live on Facebook and Apple Music on Saturday 27 July.
